pageContext.claim: “Economic growth has surged past 3 percent, something that wasn’t supposed to happen for a long time.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump routinely touts quarterly GDP growth of 3 percent, suggesting the figure was unheard of being he took office. But GDP growth has routinely topped 3 percent on a quarterly basis. Most recently, GDP growth hit 3.2 percent in the first quarter of 2015 while Obama was still in office. Trump has pledged 4 percent annual growth, which most economists think is unlikely.
